column4: I'm having trouble with CUPS configuration.  I got the printer set up, and it works on that box, but I'm getting "connection refused" and being unable to use it from another machine.
Have you gone to global-settings -> share printer?
I need to do this from the command line.
Then you'll have to manually edit the /etc/cups/cupsd.conf file.
Yeah, I've been trying to do that, and think I've allowed everything I can come up with, but still no luck.
Are you wanting IPP printer sharing, or lpd printer sharing?
Either?  Both?  IPP seems to be the default; if I could use it remotely through http that would be awesome.
You should just need to change the line that says "Listen localhost:631" to "Listen 631", and do a invoke-rc.d cupsys restart
Well, it still won't print, but links2 192.168.1.5:631/help changed from "Connection refused" to "403: forbidden" if that's any indication
Are you trying to use the web interface to modify the printers?  If that's what you're trying to do, add the cupsys user to the "shadow" group in /etc/groups, and restart cups again.
It needs to be able to read the shadow file for authentication to use the web interface.
So far I was just using the web interface to see if I could get a response at all.
Any other thoughts on why I'm not getting any response when I try to send a print job?
